Comment: Just some hard facts here:  1) Alcatraz was closed in 1963.  2) Alcatraz was built in 1934 and it hasn't been renovated or modernized since then. The electricity was upgraded but the piping, prison system, and administration facilities are beyond obsolete.   3) There would be high risk management in bringing prisoners to a tourist area let alone trucking, and infrastructure would be a nightmare as the area if over crowded with tourists.  4) It's extremely small compared to other modern prisons.

Comment: So it‚Äôs gong to need new structures built to intake the materials being brought to the island so it can rebuild and apparently expand, all the buildings are outdated and falling apart. Needs new plumbing, needs new electrical, new sewage, new security systems, since none of that either works or is up ti current standards. 24/7 transportation to and from the island for staff. Emergency transportation to a hospital, so a helicopter and landing space. Probably more than one, but maybe that could be on standby on the mainland.   Are there laws protecting Alcatraz as a historical site? It‚Äôs part of a national park.  What will be the impact to the local wildlife/ecosystem in the surrounding waters?   This will cost so, so much to build. Hundreds of millions, at least. This will cost so much to operate compared to other current prisons. This will lose tourism money. This will come out of taxpayers pockets.
